('acc', 'accgroup').desc: Account group, could use to group multiple accounts (e.g. for binders)

('acc', 'accstatus').desc: Account status. Aside from predefined values, you can use other single character values for user specific purposes

('acc', 'conddedcode2other').desc: Special condition other building deductible code

('acc', 'conddedtype2other').desc: Special condition other building deductible type

('acc', 'condlimitcode2other').desc: Special condition other building limit code

('acc', 'condlimittype2other').desc: Special condition other building limit type

('acc', 'condmaxded2other').desc: Special condition maximum other building deductible

('acc', 'condminded2other').desc: Special condition minimum other building deductible

('acc', 'condname').desc: Condition name (must be the same if condition repeats on several policy layers). Description that relates to CondNumber.

('acc', 'condnumber').desc: Condition number (must be the same if condition repeats on several policy layers)

('acc', 'deductiblebuilding').desc: Building deductible that can be used, for example, to account for fire policies before applying step functions.

('acc', 'deductiblebuildingcontent').desc: Building and content deductible that can be used, for example, to account for fire policies before applying step functions.

('acc', 'deductiblecontent').desc: Content deductible that can be used, for example, to account for fire policies before applying step functions.

('acc', 'endtriggerbuilding').desc: Ending value of the building damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.

('acc', 'endtriggerbuildingcontent').desc: Ending value of the building and content damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.

('acc', 'endtriggercontent').desc: Ending value of the content damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.

('acc', 'flexiacczzz').desc: Flexible field that is stored in FlexiAcc table in ModifierName = ZZZ

('acc', 'flexipolzzz').desc: Flexible field that is stored in FlexiPol table in ModifierName = ZZZ

('acc', 'hoursclause').desc: For perils with an inherent event duration, the insurance contract may contain an hours clause that limits the time in which claims can be added up and assigned to one event

('acc', 'islimitatdamage').desc: Indicates whether the pay-out is limited by the actual ground-up loss.

('acc', 'layerparticipation').desc: Insurance company share of the policy layer. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% entered as 0.12)

('acc', 'lob').desc: Line of business (defined at policy level)

('acc', 'minimumtiv').desc: Minimum replacement value for which pay-outs to the corresponding damage range will be allowed.

('acc', 'payoutbuilding').desc: Pay-out that covers building gross losses for this step.

('acc', 'payoutbuildingcontent').desc: Pay-out that covers building and content gross losses for this step.

('acc', 'payoutcontent').desc: Pay-out that covers content gross losses for this step.

('acc', 'pollimitcode6all').desc: Policy blanket limit code (annual aggregate only)

('acc', 'polstatus').desc: Policy layer status. Aside from predefined values, other single character values for user specific purposes can be used.

('acc', 'portnotes').desc: Portfolio notes, longer description than allowed in portfolio name

('acc', 'scalefactor').desc: Percentage factor used to scale calculated losses. This value, entered as a decimal, should be the same for all steps for a policy contract and must be a value >0 and ≤1. For example, 0.12 for 12%.

('acc', 'starttriggerbuilding').desc: Starting value of the building damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.

('acc', 'starttriggerbuildingcontent').desc: Starting value of the building and content damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.

('acc', 'starttriggercontent').desc: Starting value of the content damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.

('acc', 'stepnumber').desc: Number between 1 and 7 that is used to sort the step function in the correct order.

('acc', 'steptriggertype').desc: Code that represents how, and for which coverages, pay-outs are triggered.
